docs.abstract: United Nations Secretary Gen Ban Ki-moon is expected to have secured enough commitments from world leaders to enact 2015 Paris climate accord before end of 2016; haste is driven in part by impending American presidential election and Donald Trump's vow to withdraw from agreement.

headline.main: U.N. Signals That Climate Deal Has Backing Needed to Enter Force

docs.abstract: Pres Obama, gives final address at United Nations General Assembly, presenting stark choice between world striving for cooperation and integration or one comprised of divided and isolated nations; takes aim at leaders of countries mired in rising nationalism as well as at presidential candidate Donald Trump; leaves American foreign policy to be determined by his successor.

headline.main: Obama, in Farewell to U.N., Paints Stark Choices for Unsettled World
headline.print_headline: Obama, in Farewell to U.N., Paints Stark Choices for World
